channel.title: Lipschitz continuity on ECSE 506: Stochastic Control and Decision Theory
channel.description: Recent content in Lipschitz continuity on ECSE 506: Stochastic Control and Decision Theory

item.title: Lipschitz MDPs
item.description: Preliminaries Given two metric spaces \((\ALPHABET X, d_X)\) and \((\ALPHABET Y, d_Y)\), the Lipschitz constant of function \(f \colon \ALPHABET X \to \ALPHABET Y\) is defined by \[ \| f\|_{L} = \sup_{x_1 \neq x_2} \left\{ \frac{ d_Y(f(x_1), f(x_2)) } { d_X(x_1, x_2) } : x_1, x_2 \in \ALPHABET X \right\} \in [0, âˆž]. \] The function is called Lipschitz continuous if its Lipschitz constant is finite. Let \(\ALPHABET U\) be an arbitrary set.
